conclusion: Analyze the p-V diagram step by step.
The diagram shows two adiabatic processes (a to b and c to d) and two isochoric processes (b to c and d to a).
Adiabatic processes involve no heat exchange (Q = 0).
For adiabatic expansion (a to b), the gas does work on the surroundings, decreasing internal energy.
For adiabatic compression (c to d), work is done on the gas, increasing internal energy.
For isochoric process (b to c), heat is released by the gas.
For isochoric process (d to a), heat is absorbed by the gas.
Over a complete cycle, the internal energy of the gas remains the same (ΔU_total = 0).
The work done by the gas during expansion equals the work done on the gas during compression (W_total = 0).
Heat absorbed during isochoric process (d to a) and released during isochoric process (b to c).
Work done during adiabatic processes does not involve heat exchange.
Since internal energy returns to initial state, heat absorbed equals heat released (ΔU = Q - W).
